content.description: If <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a piecewise linear function such that <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, h of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist, which of the following could be representative of the function <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: <math alttext="h of x, equals, 12 minus x, for x less than 3; h of x, equals, 4 x minus 3, for x greater than 3." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mn>12</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 7 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “h of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 0. h of x is 3. Column 2. x is 1. h of x is eight thirds. Column 3. x is 2. h of x is seven thirds. Column 4. x is 3. h of x is 0. Column 5. x is 4. h of x is 1. Column 6. x is 5. h of x is 2. Column 7. x is 6. h of x is 3." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
